engine.mechanic: Roll d100 (percentile) against skill or characteristic value
engine.success: Roll equal or under skill = Regular success. Roll equal or under half skill = Hard success. Roll equal or under one-fifth skill = Extreme success.
engine.fumble: Roll 96-100 = Fumble if skill is under 50. Roll 100 = Always fumble regardless of skill.

procedures.combat:
Combat is deadly. Avoid when possible.
1. Each round: Declare actions, then resolve by DEX order (highest first)
2. Attack: Roll under Fighting (melee) or Firearms (ranged)
3. Defense: Target may Dodge (roll under Dodge) or Fight Back (roll under Fighting)
   - Compare successes: Higher success level wins
   - Tie on same level: Attacker wins
4. Damage: Roll weapon damage, subtract armor
5. Major Wound: Lose half or more HP in one hit = CON roll or fall unconscious
6. Dying: At 0 HP, dying. Each round lose 1 HP unless First Aid succeeds.
procedures.investigation:
Investigation is the core of the game.
1. Describe the scene with sensory details - what they see, hear, smell
2. Spot Hidden: Notice concealed items or hidden doors
3. Library Use: Research in books, archives, newspapers
4. Other skills as appropriate: Medicine (examine body), Occult (identify symbols), etc.
5. Clues should be available - rolls determine HOW MUCH they learn, not IF
6. Failed rolls may trigger delays, complications, or partial information
7. Pushing rolls: Player may push a failed roll for one more try, but failure has consequences
procedures.sanity:
Sanity represents mental stability when facing the unnatural.
1. Sanity Check: Roll under current Sanity when encountering Mythos/horror
2. Success: Lose minimum Sanity (first number)
3. Failure: Lose maximum Sanity (second number, e.g., 1/1d6 means 1 on success, 1d6 on failure)
4. Temporary Insanity: Lose 5+ Sanity in one check = bout of madness (1d10 rounds)
5. Indefinite Insanity: Lose 20%+ of current Sanity in one hour = underlying insanity
6. Maximum Sanity: 99 minus Cthulhu Mythos skill (learning the truth costs sanity)

fields.label: STR
fields.usage_hint: Physical power. Melee damage, lifting, breaking things.

fields.label: CON
fields.usage_hint: Health and hardiness. Contributes to HP, resisting poison/disease.

fields.label: SIZ
fields.usage_hint: Physical size. Contributes to HP and damage bonus.

fields.label: DEX
fields.usage_hint: Agility and speed. Determines action order in combat.

fields.label: APP
fields.usage_hint: Physical attractiveness and presence.

fields.label: INT
fields.usage_hint: Intelligence and reasoning. Idea rolls.

fields.label: POW
fields.usage_hint: Willpower and magical aptitude. Starting Sanity = POW. Determines Magic Points.

fields.label: EDU
fields.usage_hint: Education and knowledge. Determines occupation skill points.

fields.label: Hit Points
fields.threshold_hint: At 0: dying (lose 1 HP/round without First Aid). Major wound: lose half+ HP in one hit, CON roll or unconscious.

fields.label: Magic Points
fields.threshold_hint: At 0: unconscious. Regenerate 1 per 2 hours or all after 24h rest. Spent to cast spells.

fields.label: Sanity
fields.threshold_hint: Lose 5+ at once: temporary insanity. Lose 20%+ in hour: indefinite insanity. At 0: permanent insanity, become NPC.

fields.label: Luck
fields.usage_hint: Spend to reduce any roll by amount spent. Very rarely recovers. Starting Luck = 3d6 Ã— 5.

fields.label: Spot Hidden
fields.usage_hint: Notice hidden objects, secret doors, concealed clues.

fields.label: Listen
fields.usage_hint: Hear sounds, eavesdrop, detect approaching danger.

fields.label: Library Use
fields.usage_hint: Research in libraries, archives, find information in documents.

fields.label: Psychology
fields.usage_hint: Read people, detect lies, understand motivations.

fields.label: Persuade
fields.usage_hint: Convince others through charm, logic, or debate.

fields.label: Fast Talk
fields.usage_hint: Quick deception, short-term cons, verbal distraction.

fields.label: Intimidate
fields.usage_hint: Coerce through threats, physical presence, or menace.

fields.label: Fighting (Brawl)
fields.usage_hint: Unarmed combat, improvised weapons, melee fighting.

fields.label: Firearms (Handgun)
fields.usage_hint: Pistols and revolvers.

fields.label: Dodge
fields.usage_hint: Evade attacks. Can be used once per round freely, then at penalty.

fields.label: First Aid
fields.usage_hint: Emergency medical treatment. Stabilize dying, heal 1 HP.

fields.label: Medicine
fields.usage_hint: Professional medical knowledge. Diagnose illness, surgery, long-term treatment.

fields.label: Occult
fields.usage_hint: Knowledge of mystical traditions, cults, folklore (not Mythos).

fields.label: Cthulhu Mythos
fields.usage_hint: Knowledge of cosmic horrors. Cannot be improved by experience. Reduces maximum Sanity.

fields.label: Stealth
fields.usage_hint: Move silently, hide, avoid detection.

fields.label: Drive Auto
fields.usage_hint: Operate automobiles, trucks, motorcycles.

fields.label: Phobias & Manias
fields.usage_hint: Mental disorders acquired from Sanity loss.

fields.label: Spells Known
fields.usage_hint: Mythos spells learned. Each has MP cost and Sanity cost.

fields.label: Backstory
fields.usage_hint: Key background elements, significant events, personality traits.
